info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SHELBY, NORTHEASTERN DARKE, SOUTHWESTERN AUGLAIZE AND SOUTHEASTERN MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ansonia, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, New Bremen, Minster, Versailles, Newport, Fort Loramie, Ansonia, Russia, Osgood, Chickasaw, Burkettsville, North Star, Rossburg, New Weston, Yorkshire, Egypt, Rose Hill, Maria Stein, State Route 47 at US Route 127 and Eldora Speedway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
